description: Application for Minor Material Amendment (S73) to remove condition 8 (Code for Sustainable Homes) of planning permisson ref 161644FUL varied by 174113VAR dated 29.03.2018 'Construction of a two storey attached dwellinghouse (1x3bed) with habitable accommodation in the roofspace, and associated parking'
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the planning permission 161644FUL dated 06/09/2016
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans: 1932.10; 1932.11B;1932.12A; 1932.13B; 1932.14C; 1932.15A; Design and Access Statement; and Arboricultural Report ref.1-38-2205/4 dated 05/03/2015.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Parking shall be provided as per the Site Plan within the approved plan P203 (revision D, dated Nov 2013) as part of the previously approved planning permission PP/2014/2358. The off street car parking spaces shown on that approved plans shall be made available prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and this area shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with section 6 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2015 (as amended), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012) and 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013)

| The materials to be used for the external surfaces (including windows) of the development hereby approved shall match those of the adjoining dwelling at no. 2 Epsom Close and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.

Reason: In the interest of securing a high quality development and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development preserves the visual amenity of the area as a whole in accordance with section 6, 7 and 8 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2015 (as amended), policies 1.1, 1.2, 4.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013)
| The boundary treatment of the development hereby approved shall match the boundary treatment of the adjoining property at no. 2 Epsom Close.

Reason: In the interest of the visual amenity of the area and to assist providing a suitable setting for the dwelling and screening from neighbouring properties, in pursuance to the objectives of section 6 and 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.21 of the London plan 2015 (as amended), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013)

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole, in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2, (f) and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015 as amended).
| A surface drainage scheme shall be implemented for the car parking area hereby approved based on sustainable drainage principles prior to the first occupation of the dwelling hereby approved.

Reason: To ensure the drainage measures comply with sustainability requirements, and to prevent the increased risk of flooding in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026, policies 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan 2015 (as amended) and section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework.
